1.title: The End
1.plot: After a nuclear attack, a select few must survive in a bunker dubbed Outpost Three ruled by a tyrannical matriarch.

2.title: The Morning After
2.plot: Michael Langdon prepares a meeting with the guests of Outpost 3. Meanwhile, Ms. Venable and Ms. Mead have a sinister plan in store.

3.title: Forbidden Fruit
3.plot: Ms. Venable and Ms. Mead enact a sinister plan on Halloween, while a figure from the past resurfaces.

4.title: Could It Be... Satan?
4.plot: Michael's history as a teenager, and how he came to find himself at the Hawthorne Boy's school, is revealed.

5.title: Boy Wonder
5.plot: After witnessing the Apocalypse, Cordelia must act quickly to stop Michael or face the end of days.

6.title: Return to Murder House
6.plot: After being sent to the Murder House to gather information on Langdon's past, Madison and Behold discover a horrifying secret about the next Supreme.

7.title: Traitor
7.plot: With her powers waning, Cordelia enlists the help of Coco to bring justice for the coven and take the first step in stopping Michael.

8.title: Sojourn
8.plot: Michael grows desperate when his warlock allies are slaughtered and enlists the help of unlikely allies in his quest to start the apocalypse.

9.title: Fire and Reign
9.plot: Michael asks the Cooperative for help with achieving world annihilation. A tragic event at the Academy sends Cordelia and Mallory into hiding.

10.title: Apocalypse Then
10.plot: The witches prepare for a final epic battle with Michael.

1.title: Pilot
1.plot: Therapist Ben Harmon, his wife, Vivien, and their daughter, Violet, move across the country to Los Angeles to escape their troubled past.

2.title: Home Invasion
2.plot: Serial killer enthusiasts reenact the brutal murders of two nursing students, while Ben returns to Boston to fix a mistake involving an old flame.

3.title: Murder House
3.plot: Ben confronts Moira about recent strange behavior, while Vivien learns about the house's first resident.

4.title: Halloween: Part 1
4.plot: Two of the house's previous residents, interior designers Chad and Patrick, give the Harmons decorating advice.

5.title: Halloween: Part 2
5.plot: While on a date with Violet, Tate is harassed by a group of bloody teens. Ben and Vivien are haunted by one of the house's newest guests.

6.title: Piggy Piggy
6.plot: Ben sees a new patient who is terrified by the legend of a man who slaughters those who repeat a specific mantra into a mirror.

7.title: Open House
7.plot: Moira persuades a prospective buyer to make an offer. Constance and Larry work against her efforts.

8.title: Rubber Man
8.plot: The man in the rubber suit is revealed.

9.title: Spooky Little Girl
9.plot: One of history's most famous murder victims pays the house a visit. Constance discovers more of Tate's bad behavior.

10.title: Smoldering Children
10.plot: In 1994, Larry gets burned. In the present, Ben begins to understand what happened to cause Vivien's institutionalization. Constance is questioned by the police in Travis' death. Violet learns something about herself that she doesn't know.

11.title: Birth
11.plot: Vivien gives birth. Violet learns who fathered one of her new siblings.

12.title: Afterbirth
12.plot: The aftermath of Vivien's difficult labour is revealed and Ben makes plans to get out of the house. Some of the spirits have other plans and the family has to pull together to make it through these very tough changes.

1.title: Welcome to Briarcliff
1.plot: After a life-changing experience, a young man is admitted into a notorious insane asylum, while a local reporter is determined to get the full story.

2.title: Tricks and Treats
2.plot: An exorcist is summoned to Briarcliff to help save a troubled farm boy. Sister Jude's darkest secret is revealed.

3.title: Nor'easter
3.plot: A group of patients plan an escape from the asylum during a violent storm.

4.title: I Am Anne Frank: Part 1
4.plot: A new patient claiming to be Anne Frank exposes Arden's past. Kit learns why Grace was admitted to Briarcliff.

5.title: I Am Anne Frank: Part 2
5.plot: Sister Jude digs up dirt on Arden. Kit makes a surprising confession. Bloody Face is unmasked.

6.title: The Origins of Monstrosity
6.plot: A mysterious little girl is abandoned at Briarcliff. The Monsignor makes a Faustian pact with Dr. Arden. The origin of Bloody Face is revealed.

7.title: Dark Cousin
7.plot: Sister Mary Eunice is terrified to discover a dark angel has descended on Briarcliff. Kit makes a bold move to be reunited with Grace.

8.title: Unholy Night
8.plot: A murderous Santa wrecks havoc on the asylum. Sister Jude faces off with the Devil. Arden has a shocking encounter in the Death Chute.

9.title: The Coat Hanger
9.plot: The Monsignor takes on an unlikely convert. Lana secures a new piece of evidence that can exonerate Kit. Arden witnesses a miraculous return.

10.title: The Name Game
10.plot: The Monsignor confronts the Devil. Arden's experiments reach a shocking conclusion. Dr. Thredson facilitates a surprising reunion for Kit.

11.title: Spilt Milk
11.plot: Grace brings Kit devastating news about the aliens' experiments on Alma. Dr. Thredson receives an unexpected visitor. The Monsignor goes to extreme lengths to silence Jude.

12.title: Continuum
12.plot: A deadly new inmate threatens Sister Jude's chance of release from Briarcliff. Grace's obsession with the aliens turns violent.

13.title: Madness Ends
13.plot: Johnny sets out to complete his father's work. Lana leads the charge to finally shut down Briarcliff.

1.title: Bitchcraft
1.plot: After discovering her unique bloodline, a young girl is whisked away to a special academy for girls who share the same lineage.

2.title: Boy Parts
2.plot: Fiona threatens a long-standing peace when she delves into Madame LaLaurie's past, while Zoe and Madison must deal with a horrible tragedy.

3.title: The Replacements
3.plot: Fiona takes on an unlikely protege. A guilt-ridden Zoe tries to give Kyle his old life back. Madison has a fiery exchange with Joan Ramsey, a new neighbor.

4.title: Fearful Pranks Ensue
4.plot: Fiona's choices rattle a decades-long truce between the Salem witches and Marie Laveau. The Council of Witchcraft pays a surprise visit to the Academy with disturbing allegations.

5.title: Burn, Witch. Burn!
5.plot: Zoe reveals a new power during the zombie army siege. Meanwhile, Fiona exacts revenge on Myrtle when an attack leaves Cordelia blinded.

6.title: The Axeman Cometh
6.plot: When Zoe, Queenie and Nan use a ouija board to find out what happened to Madison, they awaken the spirit of a long-dead serial killer, the Axeman.

7.title: The Dead
7.plot: Fiona finds new purpose in a dangerous love affair. A night out with LaLaurie leads Queenie to question her place in the Coven. Cordelia makes a fateful decision about her mother.

8.title: The Sacred Taking
8.plot: With Fiona struggling to cope with the effects of her medication, the rest of the coven undertake a ritual known as the "sacred taking" to prepare for the next supreme. However Fiona must take her own life if the ritual is to be a success.

9.title: Head
9.plot: Cordelia's attacker is revealed. Fiona looks to form an alliance with Marie Laveau. Nan learns a disturbing truth about Luke's past.

10.title: The Magical Delights of Stevie Nicks
10.plot: Fiona attempts to out the new Supreme with a visit from Stevie Nicks. Cordelia learns the truth about Hank and the Witch Hunters. Madison tries to eliminate her competition for the Supremacy.

11.title: Protect the Coven
11.plot: Fiona and Laveau have a deadly face off with The Corporation. Cordelia makes a desperate sacrifice to protect the Coven.

12.title: Go to Hell
12.plot: Cordelia's latest vision puts the Coven's future in question. With the end of Fiona's reign approaching, the girls manifest powerful new gifts. Queenie's search for Marie Laveau leads her to Hell and back.

13.title: The Seven Wonders
13.plot: Zoe, Madison, Misty and Queenie undergo the test of the Seven Wonders, seven magical challenges that will determine the coven's next Supreme.

1.title: Monsters Among Us
1.plot: After their mother's murder, conjoined twins Bette and Dot are hired by struggling freak show owner Elsa Mars.

2.title: Massacres and Matinees
2.plot: With a killer on the loose, police impose a curfew on Jupiter. Elsa hires a strongman, unaware of his dark past with Ethel.

3.title: Edward Mordrake: Part 1
3.plot: Elsa defies superstition to rehearse on Halloween, summoning the spirit of Edward Mordrake and his ghostly band of freaks.

4.title: Edward Mordrake: Part 2
4.plot: Mordrake hunts for a freak soul to add to his ghost troupe. Jimmy and Maggie have a run-in with Twisty the clown.

5.title: Pink Cupcakes
5.plot: Stanley makes a plan to abduct and kill the Tattlers. However, Elsa has her own plan for getting rid of the sisters. Meanwhile, Dandy selects his first victim.

6.title: Bullseye
6.plot: Elsa prepares for her television show by bringing out a new act. Meanwhile, Paul pursues romance and the twins settle in to their new home.

7.title: Test of Strength
7.plot: After Dell attacks one of their own, the women of the camp plan revenge. Stanley tries to blackmail one of the freaks, and Penny confronts her father.

8.title: Blood Bath
8.plot: The freaks mourn the death of one of their own, while Elsa welcomes a new performer. Penny and her new friends get revenge on her father.

9.title: Tupperware Party Massacre
9.plot: Jimmy wallows in self-pity, and Dandy sets out to destroy the man who deprived him of the twins. Meanwhile, Desiree meets an old flame, and Elsa and Stanley track the Tattlers.

10.title: Orphans
10.plot: A death at the camp causes Elsa to seek out a new home for Pepper. Meanwhile, Desiree has enough of Dell's failure as a husband, and Stanley lends Jimmy a hand.

11.title: Magical Thinking
11.plot: A traveling salesman named Chester convinces Elsa to hire him as a magician for the show. The twins set their sights on the newcomer, while Dell and Eve help Jimmy escape.

12.title: Show Stoppers
12.plot: The freaks exact poetic justice after learning of Stanley's sins. Maggie tries to make amends with Jimmy, and Dandy tells the Tattlers some troubling information about Chester.

13.title: Curtain Call
13.plot: Dandy prepares for his debut performance. The Tattlers contemplate marriage, while in Hollywood, Elsa discovers she's further from love than ever before.

1.title: Checking In
1.plot: A pair of foreign sisters check into the Hotel Cortez, while an L.A. detective investigates a brutal murder.

2.title: Chutes and Ladders
2.plot: Fashion mogul Will Drake brings couture to the Hotel Cortez. A model catches the Countess' eye. John learns about the hotel's sadistic first owner.

3.title: Mommy
3.plot: John deals with marital issues. Donovan is targeted by a dangerous rival of the Countess.

4.title: Devil's Night
4.plot: John receives an invitation to attend an exclusive Devil's Night Soiree. Alex tries to diagnose Holden's strange condition.

5.title: Room Service
5.plot: Alex uses an unconventional treatment to save a dying patient; a Halloween-hating couple tests Iris's limits.

6.title: Room 33
6.plot: Ramona and Donovan enact their plan for revenge; Liz Taylor finds true love; the resident of Room 33 is revealed.

7.title: Flicker
7.plot: Will Drake's renovations uncover one of the hotel's greatest secrets; John undergoes psychiatric evaluation; The Countess learns the fate of her first love.

8.title: The Ten Commandments Killer
8.plot: John closes in on the Ten Commandments Killer and Sally details her arrangements with Mr. March.

9.title: She Wants Revenge
9.plot: The Countess is reunited with her one true love; Donovan and Ramona take another stab at revenge; a careless decision lands Alex in hot water.

10.title: She Gets Revenge
10.plot: Alex enlists John's help in containing an outbreak; Donovan learns The Countess' true intentions; Liz and Iris plan to leave the hotel for good.

11.title: Battle Royale
11.plot: Ramona draws vitality from an unlikely source. Sally uses her past to negotiate her future. Scarlett learns the truth of her family's affliction.

12.title: Be Our Guest
12.plot: Iris and Liz oversee a new era at the Cortez. John and Alex struggle to adapt to life outside the hotel.

1.title: Chapter 1
1.plot: Matt and Shelby, a couple from Los Angeles, leave the city and move into a mysterious house in North Carolina, where strange things begin to occur.

2.title: Chapter 2
2.plot: While the Millers discover some of their house's history, Lee falls into old habits and her daughter, Flora, makes a new friend.

3.title: Chapter 3
3.plot: The search for Flora continues as the situation grows more and more dire. The Millers talk to a paranormal expert to help them with their problem.

4.title: Chapter 4
4.plot: Shelby and Matt are saved from someone who could help them find Flora. More is learned about the colonist and the Witch.

5.title: Chapter 5
5.plot: The Butcher and her mob arrive at the house, with intent on killing Matt and Shelby, who are saved by an unlikely ally. The origins of the house are revealed.

6.title: Chapter 6
6.plot: After the wrap of the show My Roanoke Nightmare, the producer creates a follow up show called Return to Roanoke, bringing the actors of the previous show and the real Shelby, Matt, and Lee, back to the house.

7.title: Chapter 7
7.plot: Audrey, Lee, and Monet find themselves in grave danger as they search for Rory; Agnes comes back for revenge; Matt and Shelby deal with the ramifications of their situation.

8.title: Chapter 8
8.plot: Audrey, Monet, and Lee remain hostages of the Polks, while Shelby and Dominic try to think of a way to escape the wrath of The Butcher back at the house.

9.title: Chapter 9
9.plot: A new actor shows up to the house per Sidney's request; three young adults enter the woods to shoot footage of the blood moon and the history of the house for the web. Meanwhile Lee, Monet and Audrey remain on the run.

10.title: Chapter 10
10.plot: Lee Harris, the lone survivor of Return to Roanoke: Three Days in Hell, agrees to an interview live on television, the Lana Winters Special.

1.title: Election Night
1.plot: A married couple struggles with their lives and marriage while clowns terrorize the city.

2.title: Don't Be Afraid of the Dark
2.plot: Ally, Ivy and Oz meet the new neighbors. Kai runs for city council. Detective Samuels investigates a murder. A blackout terrorizes Ally.

3.title: Neighbors from Hell
3.plot: The community turns on Ally, as she and Ivy are the target of a series of disturbing events; Beverly reports on a serial killer in the area.

4.plot: Kai begins recruiting members for his cult; Beverly struggles to stay ahead of a young reporter willing to do anything to become anchor.

5.title: Holes
5.plot: Beverly's journalistic integrity is called into question; Kai plans to broadcast a gruesome murder committed by the cult; Ally's phobias reach a new low.

6.title: Mid-Western Assassin
6.plot: Ally takes Meadow to Dr. Rudy to confirm her story about the cult; An unexpected opponent runs against Kai in the city council election.

7.title: Valerie Solanas Died for Your Sins: Scumbag
7.plot: Kai begins to solidify his grasp in power; Bebe Babbitt, the former lover of the first female cult leader Valerie Solanas, warns Beverley, Ivy, and Winter about Kai.

8.title: Winter of Our Discontent
8.plot: Ally confronts Kai meanwhile Winter must choose between Kai and Beverly when he makes a questionable decision.

9.title: Drink the Kool-Aid
9.plot: Kai seeks to test the loyalty of his cult. Ally seeks revenge. Oz learns about his parentage.

10.title: Charles (Manson) in Charge
10.plot: Kai begins to unravel as he starts to suspect a traitor in his ranks.

11.title: Great Again
11.plot: Kai sets his master plan into motion as Ally's true intentions are revealed.

locations: Santa Ana Courthouse 909 N Main St, Santa Ana, CA 92701::(exteriors of asylum)
Paramount Studios - 5555 Melrose Avenue, Hollywood, Los Angeles, California, USA::(seasons 1, 2 & 5)
Hidden Valley, Thousand Oaks, California, USA::(exteriors: Season 2)
1120 Westchester Pl, Los Angeles, California, USA::(Season 1 & 8)
imdb.plot outline: Both physical and psychological horrors affect a decomposing family, workers and residents of an insane asylum, a coven of witches, a cast of circus freaks, the employees and guests at a struggling hotel, a family who moved into a mysterious farmhouse, and the members of a small suburb in Michigan in this haunting anthology series, focusing on the themes of infidelity, sanity, oppression, discrimination, addiction, and exploitation.
imdb.title: American Horror Story
plot: An anthology series centering on different characters and locations, including a house with a murderous past, an insane asylum, a witch coven, a freak show, a hotel, a possessed farmhouse, a cult, and the apocalypse.

Both physical and psychological horrors affect a decomposing family, workers and residents of an insane asylum, a coven of witches, a cast of circus freaks, the employees and guests at a struggling hotel, a family who moved into a mysterious farmhouse, and the members of a small suburb in Michigan in this haunting anthology series, focusing on the themes of infidelity, sanity, oppression, discrimination, addiction, and exploitation.

_American Horror Story_ (qv) is a horror series in which every season tells a different story. The first season is about a haunted house, and the family that has moved into it. The second season centres around an insane asylum and a man who is wrongly accused of murdering several women, including his wife. The third season tells the story of a coven of witches trying to figure out who their new "supreme" is. The fourth season is about a "Freak Show" and the lives of its performers. The fifth season is about the employees and guests at the Hotel Cortez, a building made as a secret torture chamber in the 1920s. The sixth season is about a farmhouse near Roanoke, North Carolina that is besieged by the ghosts of the infamous lost colonists and other strange happenings.::Erica Adina Amaral

_American Horror Story_ (qv) is an horror television anthology series. Each season is conceived as a self-contained miniseries, following a disparate set of characters and settings, and a story-line with its own beginning, middle, and end. While some actors appear for more than one year, they usually play completely different roles in each season.::ahmetkozan

A house haunted by murderous spirits, a catholic insane asylum from the 60s, a coven of witches, a freak show starring some truly twisted characters, a hotel filled with serial killers run by a vampire countess, an isolated haunted shack that may hold the secrets to the disappearance of the Roanoke colony, a cult on the rise after the 2016 Presidential election and an outpost that hides the few survivors of the apocalypse. Every new season comes all new, wholly American terrors in this interconnected modern horror anthology series.
synopsis: Created by Ryan Murphy, of Glee and Popular, American Horror Story is an FX original series. Described as an anthology series, AHS chronicles fictionalized haunted locations, the living and the dead who interact within them. Each season has its own self-contained storyline and characters and it has been posed that each season will introduce a new location as well as new characters and storylines. Premiering in October 2011, the first season focused its sights on a struggling family of three who move into a new house in LA. Each of them soon learn the house's demonic secrets as well as the violent and selfish spirits within its walls. American Horror Story: Asylum begins in 1964 at the fictional mental institution, Briarcliff Manor, following the stories of the staff and inmates who occupy it, and intercuts with events in the past and present.Returning cast members from the previous season of the series include: Sarah Paulson, Frances Conroy, Jessica Lange, Dylan McDermott, Evan Peters, Zachary Quinto and Lily Rabe.The season garnered seventeen Primetime Emmy Award nominations, more than any other show. The performances of Jessica Lange, James Cromwell, Zachary Quinto, Sarah Paulson, and Lily Rabe were particularly praised. Cromwell won the Emmy for Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Miniseries or a Movie, as well as Quinto and Paulson winning their respective supporting categories at the 3rd Critics' Choice Television Awards. The third season primarily follows the antics and events of a Coven of Salem descendants who reside within a boarding school, Miss Robichaux's Academy, centered in New Orleans, Louisiana. The Academy is run by headmistress Cordelia Foxx (Sarah Paulson), who has always lived in the shadow of her mother, Fiona Goode (Jessica Lange). Fiona is the Coven's "Supreme", a witch born every generation who embodies countless gifts and magical abilities, namely, the Seven Wonders of Witchcraft; the Supreme is the head of the Coven. Danger lurks inside the Academy's past due to the mysterious butler Spalding (Denis O'Hare) and his relationship with Fiona. The entire Coven is assessed and evaluated by the Council of Witchcraft, which includes Fiona's old rival and Cordelia's mother figure, Myrtle Snow (Frances Conroy).The season is set in Jupiter, Florida in 1952,[7] centered around one of the few remaining freak shows at the time, as its members do anything to keep the business alive.[8] The season focuses on the conflict between the freaks and the "evil forces" who do not understand them.[9]

camera: Panavision Panaflex Millennium XL2, Panavision Primo, PCZ and Angenieux Optimo Lenses
